forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain and patchy fog. Cloudy. Low around 38, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. Southeast wind 6 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain and patchy fog. Cloudy, with a high near 63. South wind 10 to 26 mph, with gusts as high as 48 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

weather_report:
In Boston tonight, the atmosphere hangs heavy with rain and a thick veil of fog. The clouds shroud the sky, painting everything in muted tones, as temperatures cling to the chilly side of the scale, destined to rise gently as the night unfolds. The southeast wind whispers softly, creating a melancholic symphony that dances through the damp air, while the promise of rain lingers, refreshing yet oppressive. The forecast assures a relentless downpour that will carry into tomorrow, with winds picking up, an urgent reminder of nature’s power as gusts threaten to whip through the streets.

As dawn breaks, anticipate a continuation of the damp, overcast mood, punctuated by the relentless sound of rain against pavement. These conditions suggest a day best spent indoors; perhaps one could curl up with a book or lose oneself in the creativity of the kitchen, concocting a warm soup that matches the cozy confines of home. If braving the wet weather is a must, dressing in layers—a waterproof jacket, sturdy boots, and a scarf—will provide comfort against the chill. With the rain and wind prominently in play, simplicity and warmth will guide your choices, transforming the challenges of a faded day into an invitation for introspection and domesticity.
